channel.title: BitDevs Córdoba
channel.description: BitDevs Córdoba es una comunidad en el área de Córdoba Capital para aquellos interesados en discutir y participar en la investigación y desarrollo de Bitcoin y protocolos relacionados.

item.title: Seminario Socrático #9
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusión, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Dónde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net
  • stratum.work
  • non standard txs dataset
  • mining centralization index

Presentación

  • Coinjoin: La Experiencia de Wasabi Wallet, por Lucas Ontivero.
CTV + CSFS:
  • What's a good stopping point? Follow-up: Design of operations to achieve CTV + CSFS
Noticias:
  • B4OS 2025
  • MIT DCI: New research network
  • Storm found guilty
  • Samourai devs found guilty
  • Harbor releases v1.0
  • Five years of the bitcoin design community
  • Protocolo Bitcoin by Edil Medeiros, from University of Brasilia
  • Labitbu Mania surge
  • Arkade: Virtual Execution Layer for Bitcoin-Native Applications
Análisis:
  • MIT DCI: Whirpool Analysis
  • What Network Activity Says About Changing Face of Bitcoin Users
  • Unlock bitcoin as everyday money
  • Compact block reconstruction stats
  • Ark labs: Ark explained
  • Block filter design guide
Privacidad:
  • btc++: shielded CSV to improve onchain privacy
Protocolo:
  • Non custodial ecash
  • Glock by Alpen Labs: garbled circuits for script locks on Bitcoin
  • Private access control for bitcoin keys
  • Writing programs on simplicity
  • Sharing block templates
  • Emulate soft forks using stateless TEEs
Software:
  • Weak, Slow, Key Derivation Function
  • peer-observer:A tool and infrastructure for monitoring the Bitcoin P2P network for attacks and anomalies
  • eltord: main daemon to run tor
  • Bitcoin snapshots
  • White Noise chat
  • Bitchat

item.title: Seminario Socrático #8
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusión, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Dónde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net
  • stratum.work
  • non standard txs dataset
  • mining centralization index

Presentation

  • Lucas Ontivero presents his work and researchs: Wasabi Wallet and Artificial Intelligence

Temas seleccionados

  • CTV + CSFS
  • FROST

CTV + CSFS:
  • What's a good stopping point? Making the case for the capabilities enabled by CTV+CSFS
  • Bitcoin covenant toolkit: A deep dive into CTV and CSFS
  • Bitcoin Core developer responses to OP_CTV + OP_CSFS open letter

FROST, threshold signing protocol:
  • Spiral blog: About FROST advances by Frostpunk
  • Paper: On the Adaptive Security of FROST
Noticias:
  • OpenSats Bitcoin Developer Training Report
  • Bitcoin client comparison
Análisis:
  • Eric Voskuil on Bitcoin Core's UTXO Model
  • Witnessless Sync for pruned nodes
  • Chain Code Delegation: Private Access Control for Bitcoin Keys
  • Paper: The Rich Get Richer in Bitcoin Mining Induced by Blockchain Forks
Seguridad:
  • "Denial-of-Service due to inv-to-send sets growing too large" write up
Privacidad:
  • Fingerprinting nodes via addr requests
  • On Ashigaru anonimity vulnerabilities
Protocolo:
  • BIP ?: New Opcodes for TaprootV2 by Rusty Russell
Software:
  • Bold Wallet: a seedless "warm" wallet leveraging threshold signature schemes
  • Augur: An Open Source Bitcoin Fee Estimation Library
  • Updates on bitcoinkernel library project
  • Bitcoin Core PR #32959: Reduce minrelaytxfee to 100 sats/kvB

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusión, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live

  • non standard txs dataset
  • mining centralization index

Temas seleccionados

  • Relay policy e implicaciones

Relay policy:
  • policy: uncap datacarrier by default (MERGE RATIONALE)

Covenants
  • Open letter in advocacy to CTV + CSFS
Ark:
  • neha's writing: Another explanation of how Ark works
  • arkadeos: programmable execution layer for Bitcoin
CLARITY Act:
  • Highlight tweet about the Amendment
  • Show support for section 110
  • Why it's important?
Nuevas propuestas:
  • Dust Expiry: clean the UTxO set from spam
  • Avoiding xpub+derivation reuse across wallets, in a UX-friendly manner
Privacidad:
  • Sybil resistance in coinjoin implementations
Finanzas:
  • Regulated bitcoin derivatives
  • A bitcoin haskell codebase
Noticias:
  • 0.1 sats/vB fee Tx
  • The Age of AnnexScription
  • AI Lightning payment on Bitrefill
  • New visualizaton for stratum.work dashboard

item.title: Seminario Socrático #6
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"

Bajo estas reglas, cualquier participante del encuentro es libre de usar la informacion adquirida en la discusión, pero no esta permitido revelar quien hizo ningun comentario en particular. El objetivo es incrementar la apertura del debate.

  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Dónde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas seleccionados

  • Relay Policy

Lecturas de este mes

Política de transmisión (OP_RETURN)

  • 1st PR #32359 (Bitcoin Core)
  • PR Review by Ava Chow
  • @OrangeSurfBTC provides context for Peter Todd's OP_RETURN change on 𝕏
  • 2nd PR #32406
  • bitcoin-dev: Relax OP_RETURN standardness restrictions
  • Delving Bitcoin: Addressing community concerns and objections
  • @glozow: x post
  • @SuperTestnet: x post
Recursos:
  • Bitcoin Ops Blog: internal mempool policy
  • Definición de OP_RETURN (Bitcoin Magazine Glossary)
  • An excellent example of the process of Rough Consensus
  • Why would anyone use op_return over inscriptions aside from fees?
Historia:
  • Bitmex (2022): "DApps or Only Bitcoin Transactions?"
Posturas contra los filtros:
  • Lopp: A Treatise on Bitcoin Block Space Economics
  • Pieter Wuille
  • spiral: The MEVil of Relay Policy
  • instagibbs: non-binding statement
    • instagibbs: mempool internal policy
  • gmaxwell
  • benthecarman: saving the mempool
  • Antoine Poinsot: Relay Policy Drama
    • Antoine Poinsot intervention in mailing list
Posturas pro filtros:
  • Jason Hughes: propuesta pro Knots
  • Chris Guida: opening statement btc++ debate
  • Bitcoin Mechanic: btc++ talk
Visualizaciones:
  • Cumulative OP_RETURN Output Values
  • Mining centralization vectors
  • Brc-20 in op_return
  • F2Pool quietly dropped their minimum relay fee
Medios:
  • "OP_RETURN limits: Bitcoin’s battle over arbitrary data" (Bitcoin Magazine)
Software & Protocolos:
  • LibreRelay
    • Standard Unstructured Annex
  • Hop-Return, new op_return based metaprotocol
  • Private Mempool services
  • Clementine Paper
  • BriberBroder
  • SLIPSTREAM (mara.com)
  • Tx-Pigeon
  • BTC Knots: add support for lua based tx-filter
  • OP_RETURN Bot on X
  • Garbageman:
    • cguida +1
    • instagibbs -1
    • peter todd -1
Estadísticas:
  • Non standard txs mined since last halving
  • What's the largest size OP_RETURN payload ever created?
  • Largest OP_RETURN ever
  • Cost of sending large op_returns with filters
  • Node count: luke.dashjr.org
  • %2.75 node reachability increase
  • Costs of circumventing filters
  • @sr_gi: Knots vs Core
  • @freeonlineuser: Knots vs Core
  • OP_RETURN numbers up to May 13th
Ejemplos de datos arbitrarios ("no monetarios"):
  • OP_RETURN (1)
  • OP_RETURN (2)
  • OP_RETURN (3)
  • Taproot control block (4KiB)
  • Someone inscribed this 3.7MB bitcoin music track via slipstream
  • MARA does it again
  • First mainnet use of the Taproot Annex
    • a second jpeg has hit the annex

Investigaciones revisada por pares:

  • DahLIAS: Discrete Logarithm-Based Interactive Aggregate Signatures
    • @n1ckler: announcement
    • bitcoin-dev: Discrete Logarithm-Based Interactive Aggregate Signatures
  • Round-Efficient Adaptively Secure Threshold Signatures with Rewinding
  • Thunderbolt: A Formally Verified Protocol for Off-Chain Bitcoin Transfers
  • ColliderVM: Stateful Computation on Bitcoin without Fraud Proofs
  • Carbyne: An Ultra-Lightweight DoS-Resilient Mempool for Bitcoin
  • Bitcoin, a DAO?
  • CoinMaze (withdrawn): Privacy-Focused CoinJoin Protocol for Bitcoin
  • ECDSA Cracking Methods
  • Discovering Bitcoin's Public Topology and Influential Nodes
    • CoinScope: Mempool Partitioning and Identifying Mining Nodes

Otras publicaciones:

  • BIS: DeFiying gravity? An empirical analysis of cross-border Bitcoin, Ether and stablecoin flows
  • CISA Research Paper

Covenants:

CTV + CSFS:
  • Evolving the Ark protocol using CTV and CSFS
  • Robin Linus: BitVM CTV + CSFS
  • Voltage lanza testnet en la nube para CTV+CSFS
  • Repositorio Awesome CTV con recursos sobre CTV y CSFS
  • Anthony Towns recursive covenant post
  • @robin_linus: x thread
  • Jeremy Rubin: delbrag (garbled circuits)
OP_CTV + OP_CAT:
  • Simple bitcoin vault with OP_CAT vs OP_CTV
  • WhatTheFork Coin Voting Softforks
BitVM:
  • Rootstock anuncia el primer hackatón de BitVM
  • StarkWare combina ColliderScript y BitVM en un nuevo experimento
OP_VAULT vs OP_CCV:
  • BIP draft: OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY
  • ¿Qué es CCV? (OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY)
  • @jamesob: OP_CCV and OP_VAULT
  • OP_VAULT retirado en favor de OP_CCV
    • delvingbitcoin: Withdrawing OP_VAULT (BIP-345)

Minería:

  • Cambridge Digital Mining Industry Report
  • Bitmain's S21+ update breaks connectivity to Ocean and Braiins
  • Mining Centralization Index
    • 0xB10C: Bitcoin Mining Centralization
    • @0xB10C: x post
  • Mining centralization X thread: Hash League
  • SLICE: Making PPLNS Work for Demand Response
  • Tether is deploying hashrate to OCEAN
  • Announcing Parasite mining pool
    • @kram_btc: x post
Hardware abierto:
  • The first Ember One release is now available
  • Braiins Open Source Control Board

L1:

  • delvingbitcoin: How to linearize your cluster

  • delvingbitcoin: Dust Expiry, Clean the UTXO set from spam

  • Satoshis are proposed to oficially be satoshis

    • BIP 177: Redefine Bitcoin’s Base Unit #1821
    • BIP 176: Utilization of bits denomination #618
    • Designathon: Re-basing Bitcoin

  • 64-bit arithmetic in Script

  • Removing checkpoints in Bitcoin Core v30

  • SwiftSync: Speeding up IBD 5x

    • Ruben Somsen's gist
    • The Tragic Tale of BIP30
    • BIP30 consensus failure vulnerability

  • bitcoin core PR #1835: (BIP48) add p2tr script type derivation

Cuántica:
  • Post Quantum Signatures and Scaling Bitcoin
  • Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin
  • Hourglass BIP
Investigación:
  • @mononautical: signaturless inputs
  • @mononautical: weighted multisig
  • @rot13maxi (x thread): taplocks
Musig:
  • rust-secp256k1: musig2 merged in to rust bitcoin
  • 69000/69000 musig2 key spend
Consenso:
  • BIP 54: Consensus Cleanup
    • Interview with Antoine Poinsot
    • @darosior: x post announcement of draft proposal

L2:

  • mempool.space: lightning dashboard
Noticias:
  • Stake n' Shake now accepts LN payments:
    • 1
    • 2
  • second: Ark servers vs LSPs: Liquidity requirements for Lightning payments
  • second: Erk, Ark without liveness requirements
  • arklabs: Exploring Taproot Assets in Ark
  • spark: stablecoins on statechains
  • spark: Magic Eden to add support for Spark L2
  • spark: mainnet launch
    • X announcement
  • Exodus Wallet elimina el soporte para Lightning
  • Breez anuncia una wallet similar a Aqua
  • BitGo offers Lightning
    • @BitGo: x post
  • LN Wallet Marketshare in Japan
  • Revolut integra Lightspark para pagos Lightning en UK y Europa
  • Wallet of Satoshi announces non-custodial US-approved wallet
  • Breez Nodeless supports BOLT12 and BIP353
  • Citrea lanza su red testnet Clementine
  • Autonomous Rekt: LLM Powered fuzzing with lightning payment rails
Cambios relevantes:
  • LDK: announcing VSS
  • eclair: Simplify channel keys management PR #3064
  • LDK: implement BOLT 12 Proof of Payment PR #3593
  • bolts: BOLT 12 - re-add recurrence support
  • core lightning: Add LSPS0 Client and Service Plugin
  • bolts: Make the payment secret mandatory for BOLT11
Investigación:
  • A Novel Off-Chain Transaction Framework for Channel Cooperation
  • Path Queries: Addressing Payment Reliability and Routing Limitations
Herramientas:
  • BLAST: Big Lightning Automated Simulation Tool

L3:

  • Fedimint v0.7.1
  • Herramienta para crear multisigs de ecash (Cashu Nutlock)
  • Herramienta para gastar multisigs de ecash (Cashu Witness)

Privacidad:

  • The Evolution of Payjoin

Wallets:

Descriptores:
  • delvingbitcoin: avoiding xpub+derivation reuse across wallets, in a UX-friendly manner
  • delvingbitcoin: standardized backup for wallet descriptors
  • descriptor-encrypt: a rust library to encrypt Bitcoin descriptors
Dispositivos de hardware:
  • Bitkey self-custody
  • Coldcard co-sign
  • Frostsnap Multisig Hardware wallet
Software:
  • Wasabi moving away from centralized server
  • CakeWallet adds Payjoin V2
  • GPGap: Air-gapped GPG signing Bitcoin-style
Respaldo de datos:
  • bitcoin core (PR #31250): disable creating and loading legacy wallets
  • bitcoin core (PR #28710): remove the legacy wallet and BDB dependency #28710

Noticias:

  • The 68-bit Bitcoin puzzle has been cracked!

    • mempool.space tx

  • bitcoin-dev mailing list cancelled by Google

    • relevant discussion from the last time this happened
    • @SomsenRuben: it was restored the next day
    • @jarolrod: x post
Regulaciones & Mercados:
  • El Departamento de Justicia de EE. UU. dejará de perseguir servicios de mezclado
  • Mastercard podría integrar "Kraken Pay" como parte de una alianza estratégica
  • Bitcoin Policy Institute propone “BitBonds” para adquirir bitcoin de forma neutral en el presupuesto
  • Trump bloquea la norma del IRS sobre reportes de "brokers DeFi"
  • bitcoin.org animations PR merged
  • Blockchain Regulatory Certainty Act
  • JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says the bank will let clients buy bitcoin
  • Wisconsin Sells Entire $350M Spot Bitcoin ETF Stake
  • OCC Gives Banks the Green Light to Offer Bitcoin and Crypto Custody and Trading Services
  • El fondo soberano de Abu Dabi revela una inversión de 408 M$ en el ETF de bitcoin de BlackRock
    • Tweet
  • Arizona se convierte en el segundo estado en establecer una reserva estratégica de bitcoin
  • Coinbase adquiere la plataforma de opciones de cripto Deribit por 2,9 B$

Seguridad:

  • Bitcoin Address Poisoning Attacks
  • bitmex: Bitcoin’s Duplicate Transactions
  • bitmex: The Timewarp Attack
  • Poisson Blocks DoS vector in Bitcoin at OP_NEXT by PortlandHODL
  • @orangesurfbtc: NBitcoin Crash and fix
    • Miners rolling nonstandard tx version numbers
  • NBX Explorer Nix-bitcoin Fix
  • Coinbase PII Breach & $20M Ransom
  • Antoine Poinsot: detailed analysis of CVE-2025-43707, disclosure of rust-miniscript vulnerability
  • BIP30: vulnerabilidad de fallo de consenso
  • BTCPay Server cae por vulnerabilidad
  • @orangesurfbtc: la causa de la vulnerabilidad BTCPay Server
  • Poison blocks: DoS vector on block validation

Herramientas:

  • Sovereigntools.com lanza comparativa de wallets de Bitcoin

  • Softfork research database

  • BitScript Sandbox

  • Bitcoin Feature Matrix

  • Snapshots de UTXOs para Bitcoin {main,test,sig}net

  • Removing checkpoints in Bitcoin Core v30

  • Payjoin Demo @riverKanies

  • Stable Channels @toneloc

    • @tonklaus: x post

  • mempool.space: new visualization for taproot

  • mempool.space: Block Size Report

  • mempool.space: UTXO Set Report

    • @orangesurfbtc: x post

  • mempool.space: v3.2.0

    • @mempool: x post

  • Tx Batching: Peach GroupHug

  • Nostringer: unlinkable ring signatures (SAG) for Nostr pubkeys

  • Coinswap v0.1.1

  • fuzzamoto: fuzz testing tool for Bitcoin nodes

  • secp256k1lab

  • LNBits v1.0.0 release - AppImage

  • "Cove Wallet" iOS test flight: release 0.3.0 with TAPSIGNER support

  • rust-cktap

  • Nueva versión de Frostr con aplicación de escritorio y extensión para navegador

  • electrum: soporte directo para nostr

  • electrum: soporte para plugins de terceros

  • Lanzamiento de Private Pond (coordinador de Payjoin)

  • SDK de Breez ahora con soporte para WASM

  • Lightning Terminal lanza la función “Auto Open”

  • LND 0.19.0-beta.rc4 - new RBF-based fee bumping for cooperative closes

  • BTCaccepted: A list of online only merchants

  • BTCPay Ghost integration

  • Tanos: Atomic swaps over nostr

  • Coinbase MPC library released

  • Swapido en la App Store de Fedi e integración con WebLN

Eventos

BTC++, transmisiones en vivo

  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4

item.title: Seminario Socrático #5
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Dónde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas seleccionados

TBD

Lecturas de este mes

Noticias

  • Bitcoin Core 29 Released: release notes
  • Ark on Signet
  • 256 Foundation
  • First? StratumV2 Pool
  • Hashpool v0.1: first working version
  • Nunchuck group wallet
  • Braiins open sources the BCB100
  • Private Pond open sourced: payjoin app optimized for transaction rails for services
  • Bitvault: vault against physical attacks and hacks
  • ZipZap: Nostr zaps powered by BOLT12
  • Sig4Sat: atomically exchange Cashu payments for Nostr event signatures using Schnorr adaptor signatures
  • Libre Relay to begin relaying Txs containing taproot annexes

Recursos

  • Mining architectures inphographic
  • Curated list of CSV+CSFS resources
  • secp256k1lab: Insecure and educational implementation of secp256k1 elliptic curve and related cryptographic schemes written in Python
  • Evolution of Payjoin: From Two-Party Protocol to Multiparty Framework
  • Bitcoin Core v29.0rc* testing guide
  • Coinpool Workshop
  • Ping Pong custody
  • Waye: open source developers support

Investigación

  • Cross Inputs Signature Aggregation research by Fabian Jahr
  • Taplocks: verifiable but unspendable tapleafs
  • SwiftSync: Speeding up IBD with pre-generated hints (PoC)
  • About Quantum Resistance
  • About CTV+CSFS Soft fork
  • About Consensus Cleanup: Antoine Poinsot
  • Bitcoin Core’s Priorities by Antoine Poinsot
  • DahLIAS: Discrete Logarithm-Based Interactive Aggregate Signatures
  • OP_CAT: The Path to General Computation on Bitcoin with (OP_CAT)
  • Winternitz by Schnorr signature replacement in BitVM
  • b10c blog: Invalid mining jobs by AntPool & friends during forks

Herramientas

  • Bitscript: disection tools for Bitcoin abstractions
  • Explora: a visual Tx explorer
  • Fuzzamoto: Holistic Fuzzing for Bitcoin Protocol Implementations
  • Grid: interactive block visualization tool
  • PSBT Explorer by Unchained
  • bitcoin_payment_instructions: text parser into payment instructions
  • MistyBreez: Flutter mobile reference implementation for the Breez SDK

Hard fork lobby

  • Capitalized Bitcoin Fork for National Strategic Reserve

Seguridad

  • 5 new DoS attacks discovered on Bitcoin: Script - Repository
  • Cluster mempool partitioning attacks
  • Bitcoin address poisoning attacks
  • Bitmex blog: Bitcoin duplicate transactions
  • Satoshi's version 22.0.x: Taproot DoS bug writeup

item.title: Seminario Socrático #4
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Donde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Sobre C++ y Rust (by @ishi0k): ¿Debería migrarse Bitcoin Core de manera progresiva de C++ to Rust?
  • A Treatise on Bitcoin Seed Backup Device Design - x post: conclusiones sobre diseño óptimo de dispositivos de backup por Jameson Lopp.
  • Bitcoin y Monero (by @ishi0k)¿Monero XMR o Bitcoin BTC en 2025?
  • Against Allowing Quantum Recovery of Bitcoin por Jameson Lopp.

Historia y Filosofía

  • Las ideas de Nick Szabo: The Genesis Files: With Bit Gold, Szabo Was Inches Away From Inventing Bitcoin
  • Dan Kaminsky, experto ingeniero en seguridad informática y sus ideas sobre la seguridad de bitcoin: @MiltonRodM post - @LaCryptaOk post - blog personal de Dan Kaminsky
  • The Complete Satoshi: compendio de los aportes de Satoshi Nakamoto a bitcoin entre 2008 y 2012, por el Satoshi Nakamoto Institute.

Criptografía

  • The intuition behind elliptic curve digital signatures (ECDSA)
  • Private key extraction in ECDSA upon signing a malformed input
  • The implications of Cross-Input Signature Aggregation (CISA)

Privacidad

  • Public Key Domain (by @SeverinAlexB): x post - repositorio- blog

Recursos

  • ¿Cómo empezar a contribuir en un proyecto Open Source?: repositorio
  • bitcoinwiki/cryptography
  • Programmers Friendly Zero Knowledge Book.
  • Learn me a bitcoin by Greg Walker: Sitio de referencia para aprender de bitcoin desde cero o a nivel técnico.
  • iancoleman.io: blog personal con desgloses técnicos sobre herramientas relacionadas a bitcoin.
  • BIP 380: Referencia sobre los distintos tipos de Output Script Descriptors disponibles
  • Bitcoin Optech: newsletter de avances en el desarrollo de bitcoin.
  • DIY Bitcoin Hardware
  • Let's code a TCP/IP stack, 1: Ethernet & ARP: tutorial sobre TCP/IP (rfc).

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socrático #3
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Donde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live
  • bitcointreasuries.net

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Build your own Coinpool
  • Obscura: The First VPN That Can’t Log Your Activity (Built by Bitcoiners) | Carl Dong
  • How to make a transaction with UTXOs of different wallets with Sparrow
  • Taproot Assets on Lightning
  • Apple has pulled end-to-end iCloud encryption in the UK and removed over 135,000 'non-compliant' apps from the EU App Store.
  • MicroStrategy buys 20,356 BTC for $1.9 billion.
  • Bybit exchange lost over $1.46B worth of ETH from one of its cold wallets.
  • River: What's Driving Bitcoin Adoption
  • Nigeria freed Gambaryan in exchange for access to US financial surveillance capabilities)
  • Binance sued for $81.5 billion in Nigeria.
  • Kraken discloses 40% surge in law enforcement data requests.
  • Ark v0.5.0 protocol update introduces branch-only signing sessions and connector trees

Bitcoin Wallets & Tools

  • [Utreexo v0.3.2] a hash-based dynamic accumulator based on a Merkle forest
  • [Aqua wallet v0.2.10] includes bug fixes for amount display in USDT and a not respected minimum value in internal send.
  • [Clams v0.3] New transaction filtering system for Bitcoin/Lightning accounting
  • [Ark Wallet SDK] New TypeScript library for Bitcoin wallet development with minimal dependencies
  • [SeedSigner v0.8.5] First multilingual release (Spanish) and P2TR address verification
  • [Envoy v1.8.6] UI improvements and OpenStreetMaps integration for ATM locations
  • [Bitcoin Safe v1.0.5/1.0.6] Added restore from seed option for Bitbox02 and UI fixes
  • [BDK wallet v1.1.0] Updated transaction builder and added testnet4 support
  • [Blockstream Green v2.0.20] Added Liquid discounted fees for Confidential Transactions
  • [Nunchuk Android v1.9.60] Added Android 15 support
  • [Blitz v0.4.0-beta] Fixed balance checks and QR code improvements
  • [Dana v0.4.0] Silent Payments wallet with improved coin selection
  • [Proton Wallet] New self-custodial and encrypted Bitcoin wallet for iOS/Android/web
  • [COLDCARD Mk4 v5.4.1 & Q v1.3.1] New message signing and Delta Mode improvements
  • [Sparrow v2.1.2] Fixed transaction loading and older Ledger signing
  • [Wasabi v2.5.1] Added configurable fee estimations and exchange rates
  • [Bitcoin Keeper v2.0.1] Major redesign with Miniscript integration
  • [ZEUS Wallet v0.10.0-alpha3] is now available for testing.
  • [BlueWallet v7.1.0] Added minikeys support and PSBT fixes
  • [Bitkit v1.0.9] Added fee weather widget and BTC calculator
  • [RBG v0.12.0-beta.5] is now available for testing.

Lightning & Payments

  • [Zaprite] Launched BTCPay Server integration for combined fiat/bitcoin payments
  • [Nutshell v0.16.5] Improved Lightning fee handling in Cashu protocol implementation
  • [Iris Wallet v0.1.0] First experimental RGB protocol wallet for Lightning Network
  • [Joltz Wallet Beta] Pioneering self-custody wallet for Taproot Assets
  • [LND v0.18.5-beta] Fixed AMP invoices and Postgres performance
  • [Chantools v0.13.6] Added support for ancient LNBIG channels
  • [LNbits v1.0] Entering final testing phase
  • [Lightning Terminal v0.14.1-alpha] Updated with latest daemon versions
  • [Clams v0.4] New Exports Widget for capital gains reporting

Nostr Clients & Tools

  • [Alby v3.11.0] Added dedicated Nostr key import and new language support
  • [Notedeck v0.3.0] First public release with media support and enhanced CLI
  • [BitVid] Decentralized video sharing platform using WebTorrent and Nostr
  • [Flotilla v0.2.6] Discord-style communities platform built on Nostr
  • [Futr v0.2.0] Feature-rich Linux Nostr client with threading support
  • [Rust-nostr v0.39.0] Major SDK update with expanded protocol support
  • [Vortex v1.1] Added ecash tokens and LNURL-withdraw support
  • [Olas v0.2.0] Instagram-like client with multi-image uploads
  • [Iris.to] Added integrated Cashu wallet
  • [Kanbanstr] Added card linking and filtering features
  • [Amber v3.2.1] Improved contact list signing features
  • [Fountain v1.1.16] Added Nostr livestreams support
  • [Primal v2.1] Added NWC support and Legend Cards
  • [Immortal v0.0.9] Improved relay security
  • [Coop v0.1.0-alpha] New desktop DM client
  • [txTree] New transaction visualization tool

Infrastructure & Development

  • [umbrelOS v1.4 beta 1] Home server functionality with new file management
  • [Kernel-Node] New experimental Bitcoin node implementation in Rust
  • [Haven relay v1.0.4] Extended protocol support with NIP-40 implementation
  • [Stratum v2 Tool v0.1.1] Improved mining protocol benchmarking capabilities
  • [Electrs v0.10.9] Improved DB operations for SSDs
  • [Mempool.space] Added Stratum jobs visualization features
  • [LND v0.18.5-beta.rc1] Fixed AMP invoices and improved Postgres performance
  • [ESP-Miner v2.6.0b1] New BitaxeOS testing release
  • [UTXOracle v8] Improved price discovery up to $500k
  • [Bitcoin Inquisition v28.1] Added ephemeral dust support
  • [Blockstream Explorer API] Relaunched with open beta
  • [Elements v23.2.6] Updated sidechain platform
  • [Multisigbackup.com] New tool for encrypted k-of-n descriptors

Development Tools

  • [Cashu-ts v2.2.0] New bundling pipeline for Cashu wallet development
  • [BIP-32 library] New standalone C implementation with minimal dependencies

Cashu & Ecash

  • [Nutstash v2.0.3] Multi-mint and send-to-nostr-key functionality
  • [bullishNuts v2.0.0] Standardized on cashuB token format
  • [Cashu Dev Kit v0.6.1] New development kit release
  • [Macadamia v0.2.1] First iOS App Store release with v4 token support

Security & Privacy

  • [Coinos.io] Security breach disclosure and remediation plan
  • [GrapheneOS v2025012700] Security patches and API improvements
  • [GrapheneOS v2025020500] February security patch release
  • [SimpleX Chat v6.3.0-beta.2] Added mentions-only notifications and message expiration
  • [Obscura VPN] Released for macOS with provable privacy
  • [Tails v6.12] Security updates
  • [Arti v1.4.0] New RPC interface for Tor
  • [CalyxOS v6.4.0] Android 15 support
  • [GrapheneOS v2025021100] Latest security improvements

Mining

  • [AditBoard] New USB adapter for Bitmain hashboards
  • [Braiins] Open-sourced BCB 100 mining control board

Vulnerabilidades

  • [LDK v0.1.1] Critical patch for HTLC force closing vulnerability, users urged to update

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socrático #2
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Donde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Wasabi Wallet v2.4.0 Send to Silent Payment Addresses
  • Unspendable keys in descriptors: delving bitcoin post, BIP Draft and mailing list entry
  • Silent Payment inner working in the sender side
  • BIP375: Sending Silent Payments in PSBTs
  • PSBTv2 integration testing

  • Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
  • Irrevocable fees—stealing from LN using revoked commitment transactions
  • Try bitcoin by Satsie

Vulnerabilidades

  • Irrevocable fees—stealing from LN using revoked commitment transactions
  • First practical collision for 31-step SHA-256

Nodos

Privacidad

  • Wasabi Wallet v2.4.0 Send to Silent Payment Addresses
  • Joinstr, funded by Bull Bitcoin
  • CoinSwap first public beta release, What is a CoinSwap?
  • Silent Payment inner working in the sender side

Diversión

  • Bitcoin Piñata, the first-ever piñata that pays you bitcoin

PSBTs

  • BIP375: Sending Silent Payments in PSBTs
  • PSBTv2 integration testing

Propiedad compartidad de UTxOs

  • PoC for payment pools using OP_CTV: tweet and github
  • Hurricash
  • Emulated Covenants via BitVM Integrity Checks

Lanzamientos

  • BDK releases bdk_wallet v1.0.0
  • Bitcoin Safe v1.0: Secure Bitcoin Storage Made Easy
  • Libbitcoin kernel docs
  • Bitcoin Output Script Descriptors
  • Live Wallet: wallet with native fee and privacy analysis
  • Bull Bitcoin launches serverles payjoin
  • Bitcoin Core v28.1
  • Azteco & BitKey alliance

Hardware wallets

  • Jade Plus by Blockstream

Minería

  • Stratum v2 via IPC Mining Interface tracking issue
  • Ecash TIDES using Cashu and Stratum v2
  • Block: The end of downtime in Bitcoin Mining

Academia

  • Transaction flows and holding time scaling laws of bitcoin
  • Pathfinding strategies within lightnetwork clients
  • Cash2Coin: buying and selling bitcoin in partner stores

Lecturas

  • Stats on Compact Block reconstructions
  • What's going on with testnet4?
  • Jameson Lopp's 2024 annual review

Recursos

  • Try bitcoin by Satsie
  • Bitcoin Diploma 2025 by Mi Primer Bitcoin

Consenso

  • Technical Evaluation of Selected Bitcoin Consensus Changes
  • Transitory Soft Forks for Consensus Cleanup Forks

Lightning

  • Channel depletion, LN Topology, Cycles and rational behavior of nodes
  • Building Self Custody Lightning in 2025

Taproot

  • Unspendable keys in descriptors: delving bitcoin post, BIP Draft and mailing list entry

Post Quantum

  • Protecting Quantum Procrastinators with Lifted Signatures

Escalabilidad

  • Spark

Financiación

  • Human Rights Foundation Donates 700,000,000 Satoshis To Fund Bitcoin Development And Projects

Estado

  • MiCA is live
  • Travel Rule, Bitcoin surveillance: Strike announces compliance and Kraken as well. Reflexiones de BitDevs Guadalajara
  • The regulation of cryptocurrency as a constitutional problem
  • IRS squeeze on noncustodial bitcoin services
  • Oklahoma protects free software, decentralized exchanges
  • Trump pardons Silk Road founder Ross Ulbritch
  • DoJ sued over criminalization of Software Development
  • DoJ cleared by court to sell 69000 BTC

Custodia

  • Anchor Watch launches in the US for 250K to 100M Bitcoin Holders

Finanzas

  • 2024 Stone Ridge Investor Letter
  • Blockstream Launches Asset Management Division and Introduces Two Bitcoin Investment Funds
  • Coinbase bitcoin loans are not backed by Bitcoin

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socrático #1
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Bienvenidos a nuestro segundo Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors: Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas y el soporte técnico.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Donde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com
  • utxo.live

Temas

Seleccionados

  • Reflections about a Bitcoin developer's journey
  • El dilema del consenso
  • La perdida de foco de Bitcoin Core
  • Covenant support tracker
  • On Ossification
  • "Blockchain And Bloodshed": What Soufan Center Gets Wrong On Terror Financing
  • Officials are halting Bitmain units at U.S. ports, industry firms report
  • What is the point of solo mining pools?
  • Mempal: a Bitcoin monitoring app

Bitcoin Core

  • Bitcoin Core Dev Tech 10/2024

Impacto social

  • The social layer: an ethnography of two cryptocurrency communities in the United States

Eventos

  • bitcoin++: Florianópolis
  • TABConf7
    • TABConf 6
  • OP_NEXT Livestream
    • Four takeaways from OP_NEXT

Estado

  • Czech Republic approves no capital gains tax on bitcoin after three years

Scripting

  • Lisp dialect for Bitcoin scripting
    • Basic Bitcoin Lisp language (bll)
    • Symbolic bll (symbll)
    • Bll shell (bllsh)
  • Winternitz One Time Signatures, contrasting between Lisp and Script
  • Multi-byte opcodes
  • CHECKSIGFROMSTACK(VERIFY/ADD)
  • OP_PAIRCOMMIT

Bitcoin Optech selected Q&A

  • How long does Bitcoin Core store forked chains?
  • What is the point of solo mining pools?

Contra narrativas

  • "Blockchain And Bloodshed": What Soufan Center Gets Wrong On Terror Financing

Bitcoin developer mindset

  • Reflections about a Bitcoin developer's journey

Multiparty UTXO Ownership

  • Flexible coin earmarks

Nuevos oficinas de desarrollo

  • Blockstream opens new research center in Lugano

Noticias

  • Bitcoin Fog Operator Sentenced for Money Laundering Conspiracy
  • Court overturns US sanctions against cryptocurrency mixer Tornado Cash
  • The Fifth Circuit opined that smart contracts cannot be sanctioned by OFAC
  • Code of Conduct Violation: Banning Antoine Riard for 3 months
  • Meet Willow, our state-of-the-art quantum chip
  • Newmarket Capital Launches Battery Finance, Bitcoin-Collateralized Loan Strategy AnchorWatch Becomes Lloyds of London Coverholder Set to Begin Operations in December 2024
  • Proton Wallet adds RBF
  • BitBox partners with BTC Direct to promote self custody for high-net-worth individuals

Tor

  • Tor under attack
  • Tor in Russia: A call for more WebTunnel bridges

Pensamiento adversario

  • On Ossification
  • Can parallel validation side-step the slow block issue?
  • El dilema del consenso
  • La perdida de foco de Bitcoin Core

Lanzamientos

  • Eclair v0.11.0

Hardware wallets

  • Java-based HWI released: Lark app

Minería

  • Bitdeer announces Sealminer A2
  • Officials are halting Bitmain units at U.S. ports, industry firms report
    • Bitmain launches US production line
    • Bitmain Denies Links to Huawei Supply Chain Investigation
  • Radpool: Decentralised Mining Pool With Futures Contracts For Payouts
  • Radpool
    • Custody of Miner's Coins in Radpool
    • Radpool and Fedipool
    • Validating Shares is Not a Challenge
  • Keeping it Cool: Mining Bitcoin in Space
  • Sv2 Roadmap, Q4 2024 - 2025
  • Foundry block races itself, again
  • Mystery miner has surge of luck
  • Bitcoin PoW locked outputs with arbitrary difficulty
  • Ocean supports Samourai Wallet’s legal defense despite past tensions

Lecturas

  • Marc Andreessen spotlights debanking, flood of CEO stories follow: tweet, reading list

Financiación

  • Relai raises 12M in funding series A

Recursos

  • Mempal: a Bitcoin monitoring app
  • Saving Satoshi: The world’s first interactive, practice-focused game to teach you bitcoin development.
  • Neovim Bitcoin Script plugin

Consensus

  • Continued discussion about consensus cleanup soft fork proposal

DLCs

  • The Engineering Behind DLC Markets: Crafting a Secure and Simple Trading Platform

Lightning

  • Is the scriptSig spending an PayToAnchor output expected to always be empty?
  • What happens to the unused P2A outputs?
  • An Exposition of Pathfinding Strategies Within Lightning Network Clients
  • SoK: Payment Channel Networks v4
  • Lightning Routing Replayer
  • Channel depletion, LN Topology, Cycles and rational behavior of nodes
  • Pluggable Channel Factories
  • Lightning Welder - convert Bolt 12 offers to Bolt 11 invoices
  • Research Paper on LN Payment Censorship
  • askrene: improving the MCF solver

Runas e inscripciones

  • BRC20 Pinning Attack

Silent Payments

  • Bitcoin Design Guide - Silent Payments

Post Quantum

  • Implementing quantum-safe signatures in symbll versus GSR

Escalabilidad

  • Covenant support tracker
  • Difficulty in emulating "weaker" OP_SUCCESS and why it should be a real opcode
  • Covenants Support - Bitcoin Wiki
  • Un-FE’d Covenants: Charting a new path to Emulated Covenants via BitVM Integrity Checks
  • ColliderScript: Covenants in Bitcoin via 160-bit hash collisions, summary
  • Slashing covenants
  • Implementing a Bridge Covenant on OP_CAT-Enabled Bitcoin: A Proof of Concept
  • Implementing a Bridge Covenant on OP_CAT-Enabled Bitcoin: A Proof of Concept
  • Non-custodial ecash
  • Ark - Unlocking Liquidity Before Shared Output Expiration
  • Bitcoin Virtual Channels: Bringing Instant Settlement To Ark
  • 26% optimization in BitVM-style SHA256 script implementation
  • Bitcoin OP_CAT Use Cases Series #5: Drivechain
  • op_CAT vs op_CTV vs XMR
  • OP_EXPIRE: Mitigating replacing cycling attacks
  • CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
  • The Practical Economics of a BitVM Bridge
  • lnhance

Criptografía

  • How does ColliderScript improve Bitcoin and what features does it enable?
  • Adaptors Generalized
  • From One-Time to Two-Round Reusable Multi-Signatures without Nested Forking
  • On Concrete Security Treatment of Signatures Based on Multiple Discrete Logarithms
  • One-More Unforgeability for Multi- and Threshold Signatures
  • Push-Button Verification for BitVM Implementations
  • Schnorr Signatures are Tightly Secure in the ROM under a Non-interactive Assumption
  • A Tight Analysis of GHOST Consistency
  • Algebraic Zero Knowledge Contingent Payment
  • Foundations of Adaptor Signatures
  • Functional Adaptor Signatures: Beyond All-or-Nothing Blockchain-based Payments
  • Glacius: Threshold Schnorr Signatures from DDH with Full Adaptive Security
  • Two-Round 2PC ECDSA at the Cost of 1 OLE
  • Universal Adaptor Signatures from Blackbox Multi-Party Computation
  • zkalc - calculate how much time cryptographic operations take on a real computer
  • Hash-Based Signature Schemes for Post-Quantum Bitcoin
  • BIP Draft: FROST signing

Vulnerabilidades

  • Full Disclosure: "Transaction-Relay Throughput Overflow Attacks against Off-Chain Protocols"
  • Public disclosure of one vulnerability affecting Bitcoin Core <26.0
  • Disclosure: irrevocable fees---stealing from LN using revoked commitment transactions
  • Full Disclosure: “Transaction-Relay Throughput Overflow attacks against Off-Chain Protocols
  • Deanonymization vulnerability affecting Wasabi and related software

Ataques

  • Slow Block Validation Attacks
  • Prevent future duplicate coinbase transactions as part of Consensus Cleanup

Auditorías

  • BDK 2024 Q4 Code Audit

Wallet Backup

  • File Format for Wallet Inheritance and Recovery

Nodos

  • Boost Your Bitcoin Node Sync With UTXO Snapshots
  • Bitcoin Core on ARM (Windows)
  • Multiprocess Bitcoin Core
    • BDK Wallet PoC using multiprocess Bitcoin Core

Repositorios

Bitcoin Core
  • wallet: fix crash during watch-only wallet migration
  • Package validation: accept packages of size 1
  • rpc: Remove submitblock pre-checks
  • Improve parallel script validation error debug logging
  • dbwrapper: Bump LevelDB max file size to 32 MiB to avoid system slowdown from high disk cache flush rate
  • rpc: add getdescriptoractivity
  • policy: ephemeral dust followups
  • bench: add support for custom data directory
  • Add destroy to BlockTemplate schema
  • cluster mempool: Implement changeset interface for mempool
  • validation: fix m_best_header tracking and BLOCK_FAILED_CHILD assignment
  • benchmark: Improve SipHash_32b accuracy to avoid potential optimization issues
  • validation: Remove RECENT_CONSENSUS_CHANGE validation result
  • addrman: cap the max_pct to not exceed the maximum number of addresses
  • Ephemeral Dust
  • test: enhance p2p_orphan_handling
  • test: Add combinerawtransaction test to rpc_createmultisig
  • depends: Specify CMake generator explicitly
  • tracing: Only prepare tracepoint arguments when actually tracing
  • Remove mempoolfullrbf
  • TxDownloadManager followups
  • net: Use actual memory size in receive buffer accounting
  • netinfo: add peer services column and outbound-only option
  • init: warn, don't error, when '-upnp' is set
BDK
  • fix(electrum): prevent fetch_prev_txout from querying coinbase transactions
  • fix(tx_builder)!: make TxBuilder Send safe, remove Clone trait
  • feat(chain,wallet)!: Transitive ChainPosition
  • Sqlite - allow persisting anchor without tx
  • Check time when persisting in rusqlite impl
  • fix(core): Fix checkpoint Drop stack overflow
  • Use bitcoin::constants::COINBASE_MATURITY
HWI
  • add Trezor Safe 3 and Safe 5 to device support matrix table
  • Add BitBox02 Simulator
rust-bitcoin
  • Explicitly define Ord for NodeInfo
  • units: test for C-SEND-SYNC
  • Add API scripts and output files
  • Change Amount::MAX from u64::MAX to Amount::MAX_MONEY
  • Close amounts error types
  • Add string regression tests in leaf crates
  • units: Remove serde from amounts
  • Fix internal weight calculation
  • Account for data pushing opcodes in is_standard_op_return
  • Fix psbt fuzz crash
  • Deprecate iwp weight
  • units: Add integration test of API surface
  • Re-design and move Block to primitives
  • Remove From and Into test impls and create test-specific function for converting between Rust primitives and U256
  • transaction: Add plural field getters
  • Fix bug in witness stack getters
  • Split checked_div_by_weight into floor and ceiling version
  • Fix bip34 number parsing for Block
  • Improve the amount module
  • Update rust-bitcoin-maintainer-tools
  • script: remove unsafe marker from slice-to-script conversions
  • Introduce impl_bytelike_traits macro
libsecp
  • Clear sensitive memory without getting optimized out (revival of #636)
  • Name public API structs
Core Lightning
  • Release v24.11
  • onionmessage forward fail notification
  • Quieten gossipd
  • xpay maxfee fix
  • decode: don't fail to decode just because a bolt12 invoice has expired.
  • Enable seeker autoconnect when started with no peers, disable when --offline
  • connectd: fix crash when we get an incoming conn while outgoing attempt is ratelimited
  • gossipd: fix crash in seeker rotation code.
  • connectd: force our own channel gossip to more peers
  • Anchor code cleanup: always use anchors, but only boost to estimateblockfee 12.
  • Fix: don't send anchorspends for onchain commitment txs
  • Handle connection better: make connectd know which peers are important
  • common: Add a debug mode for tracing
  • Xpay: add one to CLTV blockheight
  • pyln-client: restore backwards compatibility with CLN prior to 24.08
  • Seeker autoconnect
  • tests: add pay test over unannounced channels
  • askrene: improving the MCF solver
  • lightningd: tell gossipd channel is closed if it tells us about our channel and is wrong.
  • Aggressive Gossip Seeker
  • Splice Interop
  • Fix offer payment failure
  • bolt12: allow to inject payer_metadata
  • Offers: Not just for breakfast anymore!
  • xpay: a rewritten payment plugin using askrene and injectpaymentonion
  • New RPC command listaddresses
  • close: Print multiple txs; Fixes #6467
  • Agressive Channeld Restart Testing
  • bookkeeper testing for splice-in + splice-out
  • lightningd: deprecate decodepay.
  • hsmtool.c - Added new method to enable creation of hsm_file from cmd-line args
  • onchaind: replay using real block data, not db
  • exposesecret: a way to back up the hsm_secret via rpc (if enabled!)
  • Add strict-forwarding option
  • add listing options to listpays
  • Add RPCs to bookkeeper so you can update/set a description on an event
  • splice: Script for complex splices
  • Askrene refinements: better documentation, channel biases
  • Fakechanneld for testing against real topology.
  • renepay: pay BOLT11 invoices with description_hash
  • bolt12: fix typo about parameters name in err str
  • gossipd: Correct evaluation of new channel announcement timestsamp
eclair
  • Remove obsolete WatchFundingConfirmed when using RBF
  • Decrypt on-the-fly funding trampoline failures
  • Properly type Sphinx shared secrets
  • Refactor Sphinx failures
  • Check HTLC output status before funding HTLC tx
  • Various refactoring for trampoline blinded paths
  • Rename blinding to pathKey
  • Refactor trampoline-to-legacy payments
  • Allow plain outgoing_node_id in blinded payment_relay
  • Simplify trampoline test helpers
  • Update Bitcoin Core to 27.2
  • Add logs for balance estimate
  • Add force-close notification
  • Make cluster serialization support unknown messages
  • Don't relay buggy extra payments
LDK
  • Support Trampoline flag in BOLT12 invoices
  • Persist unresolved ChannelMonitors on empty height change
  • Misc updates to tee up async ChannelMonitorUpdate persist for claims against closed channels
  • Gossip filtration fix
  • Add the ability to fetch a probability from live liquidity bounds
  • Stop sending channel_update in onion failures
  • Expand on RGS caching requirements
  • Document RGS timestamp usage
  • Implement accepting dual-funded channels without contributing
  • Follow-ups for ChannelManager::create_bolt11_invoice
  • Don't interpret decayed data as we've failed to send tiny values
  • Disallow user-provided payer_signing_pubkey
  • Support paying directly to Human Readable Names using bLIP 32
  • Verify blinded keysend payments
  • Add ChannelManager::create_bolt11_invoice
  • Experimental offer TLVs
  • Re-broadcast channel_announcements every six blocks for a week
  • Include invoice requests in async payment onions
  • Drop dead code from provide_latest_counterparty_commitment_tx
lnd
  • (3/4) - lnwallet/chancloser: add new protofsm based RBF chan closer
  • routing: fix mc blinded path behaviour.
  • lnrpc: sort Invoice.HTLCs based on HtlcIndex
  • (custom channels): refactor AuxTrafficManager to be used for forwarding as well
  • Don't block on channel arbitator startup
  • chainreg: use feerate estimator in regtest and simnet
  • cmd: fix default timeout for estimateroutefee
  • (1/3) Graph RIP: refactor+graph: move all graph related DB code to the graph package
  • DynComms (1/n): Implement Quiescence Protocol
  • Add Experimental Endorsement Signalling
  • pagination: add pagination to wallet transactions
  • localchans: recreate missing edge if not found
  • lnwallet: log the amounts in the same unit
  • lnd: stop graphBuilder during shutdown
  • (custom channels): add taproot overlay channel type to channel acceptor
  • fix chanArb deadlock
  • peer+lnd: fix peer blocking on node shutdown
  • multi: generate and pass along HTLC resolution blobs for aux channels
  • routerrpc: fix sendpayment_v2 negative fee limit
  • multi: fix rpcclient shutdown
  • htlcswitch: merge htlc custom records on modify
  • Deprecate dust-threshold config value
  • Cancel back outgoing dust htlcs before commitment is confirmed.
  • lnrpc: return meaningful response instead of empty one
  • Add maxFeeRatio parameter to sanityCheckFee in psbt coin selection
  • (walletrpc): add sat_per_kw fee option to FundPsbt RPC
  • routing+migration32: update migration 32 to use pure TLV encoding for mission control results
BIPs
  • BIP-373: denote different public key types/purposes consistently
  • BIP125: update status to Final
  • BIP 348: OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
  • Add BIP 349: OP_INTERNALKEY
  • BIP373: Clarify where keys in MuSig fields may appear in the Taproot output
  • BIP390: Clarify that musig cannot be used in top-level pk() or pkh()
BLIPs
  • Update bLIP 32 to point to BOLT 12 for name/domain inclusion
BOLTs
  • Include BIP 353 name info in invoice_requests
  • Add a generic Code of Conduct

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education

item.title: Seminario Socrático #0
item.author: Unknown
item.description:
Agenda

18:30hs Previa con maní y cerveza
19:00hs Seminario Socrático donde revisamos múltiples temas relacionados con Bitcoin
20:00hs Cierre

Ubicación

El evento se organiza dentro del espacio de Bitcoin School Argentina:

Bv. Chacabuco 625
1º piso, Salón Principal
Córdoba, Argentina X5000

Map

Anuncios

Estamos muy felices de introducir nuestro primer Seminario Socrático! Un especial agradecimiento a nuestros sponsors Bitcoin School Argentina por el espacio y a B4OS por las bebidas.

Recordatorios

  • No se permiten fotografías, vídeos o grabaciones de audio
  • Nos adherimos a "the Chatham House Rule"
  • Deja el espacio del encuentro tan limpio como lo encontraste.
  • Sugiere temas para el siguiente Seminario Socrático! ¿Donde encontrar temas para futuros seminarios?

Temas

Estadísticas de la Red

  • mempool.space
  • clarkmoody.com

Eventos

  • bitcoin++: Florianópolis
  • TABConf7

Nuevos oficinas de desarrollo

  • 2140 in Europe
  • Localhost Research in San Francisco

Noticias

  • Telekom tests Bitcoin mining with surplus energy
  • Namecheap processes 1.1m transactions with BTCPay

Lanzamientos

  • Bitcoin Core 28.0
  • Zeus White
  • Lightspark unveils an L2 using statechains
  • Boltz BOLT 12 Swaps
  • BTCPay Server 2.0: our biggest update yet!, video

Hardware wallets

  • Bitkey featured in Time's best inventions of 2024
  • Bitkey Whitepaper

Minería

  • Introducing Proto: Building the future of bitcoin mining hardware

Estado

  • Bitcoin Act 2024

Financiación

  • Blockstream raises $210M from Fulgur etc.
  • Report: Building Bitcoin - Funding a $1.2 Trillion Dollar Project

Recursos

  • Guide for Wallets Employing Bitcoin Core 28.0 Policies
  • EmailBTC
  • BitVMX website
  • Bitcoin Balance API
  • Fabric, DNS resolver for spaces
  • Battle of Galen Erso
  • Libbitcoin for Core people

Curiosidades

  • Satoshi9000 random number generator

Lightning

  • LN Summit 2024 Notes & Summary/Commentary
  • 0 fee lightning tx

Sincronización de la cadena

  • libbitcoin syncs full blockchain in 1 hour

Runas e inscripciones

  • Runes mint timelapse
  • BRC20 Pinning Attack

Silent Payments

  • Bitcoin Design Guide: Silent Payments

Post Quantum

  • QuBit - P2QRH spending rules
  • Post Quantum Sigs with GSR - Delving Post

Censura

  • Payment Censorship in the Lightning Network Despite Encrypted Communication, delvingbitcoin post, calle tweet

Escalamiento

  • OPR - Offchain Payment Resolution Protocol
  • SuperScalar: Laddered Timeout-Tree-Structured Decker-Wattenhofer Factories
  • CAT Protocol

Más alla del código

  • The distributional consequences of Bitcoin
  • BCAP: Analyzing Bitcoin Consensus: Risks in Protocol Upgrades, Steve's bcap tweet thread

Criptografía

  • Adaptors generalized
  • DLEQ BIP Draft

Revelación de vulnerabilidades

  • CVE-2024-38365 public disclosure (btcd FindAndDelete bug)
  • Disclosure of CVE-2024-35202
  • Disclosure of DoS due to inv-to-send sets growing too large
  • Disclosure of hindered block propagation due to mutated blocks
  • Disclosure of hindered block propagation due to stalling peers

Repositorios

  • rust-bitcoin: Support Testnet4 Network #2945
  • rust-bitcoin: Add version three variant to transaction version #3450
  • rust-bitcoin: Add the ChaCha20Poly1305 AEAD algorithm #2960
  • bitcoin-core/secp256k1: Add module "musig" that implements MuSig2 multi-signatures (BIP 327) #1479
  • bitcoin-core: Drop miniupnp dependency #31130
  • bitcoin-core: Remove mempoolfullrbf #30592
  • core-lightning: pay: Remember and update channel_hints across payments #7494
  • lnd: cmd: allow deterministic macaroon derivation with lncli #9172
  • Eclair: Add support for RBF-ing splice transactions #2925
  • LDK: Add the core functionality required to resolve Human Readable Names #3179
  • LDK: Re-broadcast channel_announcements every six blocks for a week #3360
  • LDK: Include invoice requests in async payment onions
  • LDK: Support paying directly to Human Readable Names using bLIP 32 #3283

Oportunidades educativas o laborales

  • Bitcoiner Jobs
  • Summer of Bitcoin
  • B4OS
  • Chaincode Labs: Bitcoin and Lightning Protocol Development Education
